DOC.brief_summary: Cancer patient often report include important treatment decision . Numerous study show train concern Shared Decision Making ( SDM ) physicians improve situation . This lead well quality doctor-patient interaction , may positive long term impact treatment adherence , psychological well-being cop ability patient . However , previous experience regard implementation SDM training program show difficult recruit physicians external SDM group train due extensive workload physician . In light available evidence effectiveness SDM training low motivation oncologists traditional SDM group training , study aim develop evaluate brief SDM intervention . This intervention disseminate two different way might attractive oncologist . On one hand individual face-to-face context-based SDM training design conducted trainer workplace participate oncologist . On hand web-based SDM online training develop . Both SDM intervention develop basis SDM manual evaluate previous study . This study therefore aim examine effectiveness different dissemination strategy ( individualized face-to-face context-based SDM individual training vs. web-based SDM online training ) compare control group without training . It analyze improvement medical SDM competence accomplish different SDM training . Further effect train SDM knowledge , quality doctor-patient interaction SDM self-efficacy expectation evaluate .
DOC.brief_title: RCT Regarding SDM Online Training Face-to-face SDM Training
DOC.criteria: 1 . Oncologists physicians treat significant percentage breast and/or colorectal cancer patient 2 . Internet access No Exclusion Criteria
